title: 17.4 Dynamic Tables
content:
Section 17.4

Dynamic Tables

Summary

Tables that grow and shrink automatically with amortized O(1) operations.

Key Points

  • Insert: if full, allocate double-size table, copy everything
  • Delete: if quarter full, allocate half-size table, copy
  • Single insert/delete: O(n) worst case!
  • Amortized analysis: O(1) per operation
  • Potential: captures how close to needing expansion/contraction

Example

Table with n items. Insert doubles to 2n when full. But doubling happens only after n inserts. Cost n spread over n ops = O(1) each.

Why It Matters

How ArrayList/vector implementations work. Crucial for practical performance.
